newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SHARES IN ASML UP FIVE PCT ON BUY TALK.
newsitem.headline: SHARES IN ASML UP FIVE PCT ON BUY TALK.

text.p: Shares in Dutch semiconductor equipment maker ASM Lithography rose five percent or 5.20 guilders to 108.20 on the Amsterdam stock exchange on Wednesday on take-over speculation.

Market rumours had Intel of the U.S. -- the world's biggest maker of computer chips -- or Japanese electronic tools manufacturer Hitachi being interested in acquiring ASML, but analysts downplayed the speculation.
"All these rumours nowadays seem to be generated on the floor of the stock exchange itself. It goes with the excitement that prevails in the sector," SNS Securities analyst Bert Siebrand said.
"I don't believe much of it. Intel isn't active in that line of activity...and I don't think Philips would want all wafer-steppers to be produced in Japan," he said.
Dutch Philips Electronics NV owns 23.9 percent of ASML.
ASML, a volatile stock which hit a 72.50 guilders low on April 24, reached a life time high of 108.20 guilders today.
